html: 12.2.18  8:39 pm   I LOVED your h3h3 podcast interview would you ever do more?

12.2.18  8:21 pm   How come when a black artist puts out a popular song it's called R&B, but when a white artist puts out a popular song it's called pop?

      If beyonce did 'all about that bass' it would probably be called an R&B song, and if megan trainor did 'single ladies' that would probably be called a pop song? I know you don't like labeling genres,

      but the charts and music stores and radio stations do.

     If so, how do you overcome that?

12.2.18  6:00 pm   to me being creative means being able to do things like write my own songs. Ive been playing piano for 12 years and i can learn songs well from sheet music but i cant make my own songs. i have a voice to sing with but i cant come up with lyrics or melodies. i want to learn to be able to create

12.2.18  3:58 pm   I'm a self taught pianist and lately I've been wanting to start incorporating jazzy elements and melodies into my compositions. I have a pretty good grasp on music theory, but incorporating these elements is really hard for me. It always seems forced, even when utilizing 7ths and going off key with the help of the circle of fifths, I can't make it sound truly organic. I'd really appreciate some advic on how to do better.
